turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Momus.
turn.1: What are the main criticisms of Momus?
turn.2: As another result, Momus became a by-word for fault-finding, and the saying that if not even he could criticize something then that was the sign of its perfection.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Thus a poem in the Greek Anthology remarks of statues by Praxiteles that "Momus himself will cry out, 'Father Zeus, this was perfect skill'.
turn.5: Did anyone else have any criticisms?
turn.6: " Looking the lovely Aphrodite over, according to a second fable of Aesop's, number 455 in the Perry Index, it was light-heartedly noted that he could not find anything about her to fault except that her sandals squeaked.
turn.8: A social comedy from the 2nd century CE served as inspiration for later criticisms of society.
turn.9: What did Lucian have to say?
turn.10: This was found in Lucian's "The Gods in Council", in which Momus takes a leading role in a discussion on how to purge Olympus of foreign gods and barbarian demi-gods who are lowering its heavenly tone.
turn.11: Did anyone else have anything to add?
turn.12: At the start of the Renaissance, Leon Battista Alberti wrote the political work "Momus or The Prince" (1446), which continued the god's story after his exile to earth.
